description: An increase in Russian attacks on Ukrainian port infrastructure in recent weeks threatens food shipments to destinations from Gaza to southern Africa, the UK warned.
title: UK Warns of Grain Threat After Russia Steps Up Black Sea Attacks

description: Bill Gates privately said he has recently donated about $50 million to a nonprofit organization supporting Kamala Harris’ presidential run, the New York Times reported, citing three people briefed on the matter.
title: Bill Gates Backed Harris With $50 Million Donation, NYT Says

description: South Korean consumers’ confidence in the country’s housing-market rally weakened for the first time since the start of the year, underscoring the impact of government steps that helped cool the real estate market and pave the way for a central bank pivot.
title: South Koreans’ Home Prices View Weakens for First Time in Months

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, economics editor Megan O’Neil looks at the everyday costs not captured in the consumer price index. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: The Hidden Inflation That's Weighing on Voters in 2024

description: The ruling party looks set for a bruising election night. The question for its leader Shigeru Ishiba is how bad the damage will be.
title: Japan’s New Leader Is Scrambling to Stem the Electoral Bleeding

description: The US Commodity Futures Trading Commission is at an “inflection point” after a court decision legalized contracts that allow speculators to bet on election outcomes, Chairman Rostin Behnam said in a Bloomberg Television interview.
title: CFTC Chief Sees Agency Stretched Thin by Election Bets, Crypto

description: The outcome of the upcoming US election isn’t just a domestic issue, but a vote on the future of liberal democracies and Western values around the world, according to Germany’s Finance Minister Christian Lindner.
title: US Election Is Vote on Liberal Democracy, Germany’s Lindner Says

description: China’s response to Pakistan’s request to lengthen maturities for debt involved in the Belt and Road Initiative has been encouraging, according to Pakistan’s finance minister, signaling more breathing room for the nation that has been squeezed by costly past borrowing.
title: Pakistan Says Debt Reprofile Talks With China Are Encouraging

description: India removed restrictions on shipments of non-basmati parboiled rice, a move that’s likely to boost the nation’s competitive edge in the world market and boost earnings of local farmers during the current harvesting season.
title: India Scraps Tax on Some Rice Exports to Boost Competitiveness

description: US presidential candidates are deploying unusual tactics as they try to scrounge loose any undecided voters with two weeks out to an election that polls forecast as a razor-tight race.
title: Springsteen, Rogan and Musk Help Candidates Reach Swing Voters

description: The US’s top diplomat and Israel’s Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu agreed Tuesday that the killing of Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar opens new possibilities for ending the conflict in the Gaza Strip but gave no indication that a 2 1/2-hour meeting yielded an accord on what comes next.
title: Blinken and Netanyahu Agree Sinwar’s Death Opens Possibilities

description: The FBI is investigating the leak of classified documents that detailed Israeli preparations to retaliate against Iran, as officials seek to clamp down on yet another embarrassing disclosure of US intelligence secrets.
title: FBI Probes Leak of Top Secret Documents on Israel Attack Plans

description: Mozambican opposition leader Venâncio Mondlane brandished the threat of “revolution” and called for a two-day protest after alleged fraud in this month’s elections and the murder of his legal adviser. The southeast African nation’s Eurobonds fell.
title: Mozambique Opposition Talks ‘Revolution’ as Election Tally Looms

description: Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen said Tuesday that the US is nearly ready to offer $20 billion toward a broad Group of Seven-led loan program to help Ukraine.
title: Yellen Says US Aims to Contribute $20 Billion for Ukraine Loan

description: The International Monetary Fund said the US election is creating “high uncertainty” for markets and policymakers, given the sharply divergent trade priorities of the candidates.
title: US Election Creates ‘High Uncertainty’ for Fragile Markets, IMF Says

description: Russia and Iran may seek to foment violent protests inside the US in the days and weeks after the Nov. 5 election as voting results are being tabulated and certified, US intelligence agencies warned on Tuesday.
title: Russia, Iran Seen by US as Instigators of Violence Post-Election

description: Christine Lagarde challenged two of Donald Trump’s key gripes by defending monetary-policy makers and the importance of global trade.
title: Lagarde Says Trump Should Visit to See How Hard Fed’s Job Is

description: The King of Sweden will award the Royal Order of the North Star to U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken, former NATO secretary-general Jens Stoltenberg and eight other foreign citizens for helping Sweden join the North Atlantic Treaty Organization.
title: Sweden Honors Stoltenberg and Blinken for NATO Accession Roles

description: Kenya’s High Court upheld the validity of a tax measure that President William Ruto is using to raise funding for affordable housing, boosting his attempts to steady the nation’s finances.
title: Kenyan Court Upholds Ruto’s Tax to Fund Affordable Housing

description: Turkey’s state-owned Halkbank can be prosecuted for conspiring to violate US sanctions against Iran, a federal appeals court ruled.
title: Halkbank Prosecution Can Go Forward, US Appeals Court Says

description: Canada and the US will disagree at the “fringe” but are likely to find common ground on free-trade negotiations in the coming years, according to Royal Bank of Canada Chief Executive Officer Dave McKay.
title: US, Canada Will Clash at ‘Fringe’ in Trade Talks, RBC CEO Says

description: The International Monetary Fund lowered its global growth forecast for next year and warned of accelerating risks from wars to trade protectionism, even as it credited central banks for taming inflation without sending nations into recession.
title: IMF Lowers Global Growth Forecast, Warns of Increasing Risks

description: A key ally of Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan called for the imprisoned leader of the militant Kurdistan Workers’ Party, or PKK, to be freed if he announces the dissolution of the group.
title: Erdogan Ally Calls for Kurd Militia Leader’s Conditional Release

description: It’s been a longstanding knock on the Democratic Party: Its national candidates might win more votes, but its state and local officials fall short in races that matter for everything from abortion access to certifying elections.
title: Democratic Donors Are Deploying a ‘Moneyball’ Strategy to Tip Local Races

description: Austria’s president asked the ruling conservative party to start coalition negotiation with the Social Democrats, snubbing the most popular far-right Freedom Party after it failed to find a potential partner.
title: Austrian President Asks Runner-Up Conservatives to Form Cabinet

description: Ukraine expects to receive $1.6 billion from the US to finance domestic production of long-range weapons, boosting the country’s ability to strike military targets in Russia, President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said.
title: US to Provide $1.6 Billion for Kyiv’s Long-Range Arms Production

description: For more than a year, Russia has been leaning on its increasingly close ally North Korea for supplies of artillery shells and ballistic missiles to prosecute its grinding war in Ukraine. Now, Ukrainian officials are warning that North Korea plans to expand its assistance by dispatching troops. South Korea’s chief intelligence agency said on Oct. 18 that it had monitored the Russian navy moving North Korean forces to Russia as a first step toward sending them to the frontlines in Ukraine. The Kre
title: Why 1,500 North Korean Troops Have the World’s Attention

description: China and India, nuclear-armed neighbors, have had thousands of troops facing off in a contested region of the Himalayas since 2020, when skirmishes led to the first deadly clashes in four decades. In October, a deal was struck with a view to resolving the dispute that’s bedeviled ties between the world’s two most populous nations. Both sides offered praise for the agreement, but it remains to be seen how much of a thaw will come.
title: What Deal on China-India Border Dispute Means for Ties

description: Ireland’s government pumped just over €4 billion ($4.4 billion) into its new sovereign wealth fund, which it aims to grow to more than €100 billion ($108 billion) as part of a plan to better manage its finances.
title: Ireland Puts €4 Billion Into Its New Sovereign Wealth Fund

description: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi hailed his country’s growing relations with Russia as he met President Vladimir Putin on the sidelines of the BRICS summit of emerging powers.
title: Modi Touts Closer Russia Ties at BRICS Summit Amid US Annoyance

description: For decades, China has sought to maintain influence among armed ethnic groups in Myanmar in lawless border areas while also providing support to military leaders in charge of the Southeast Asian nation. An attack on its consulate last week shows that balancing act is becoming untenable.
title: Xi Faces Dilemma as Consulate Blast Sparks Fear of Myanmar Chaos

description: When early voting starts in the swing state of Wisconsin on Tuesday, former President Barack Obama will be there to urge Black residents to hit the polls and choose Kamala Harris. His job is getting tougher.
title: Obama Heads to Wisconsin in Trump-Harris Battle for Black Voters

description: Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves is considering plans to increase taxes paid by online giants such as Amazon.com Inc., as she seeks to bolster UK high street shops in her budget next week.
title: Reeves Considers Amazon Tax Hike to Aid Bricks-and-Mortar Stores

description: Elon Musk’s super political action committee, America PAC, is awarding a daily prize of $1 million to a registered voter in a swing state, the latest effort by the world’s richest person to help get Donald Trump back in the White House. Photographs of Musk handing winners over-sized checks adds yet another plot twist to a US presidential election that’s among the most dramatic in the country’s history — between the Republican former president and his opponent, Vice President Kamala Harris.
title: Is Elon Musk’s $1 Million Giveaway Legal?

description: India’s Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said the nation faces a significant challenge skilling its vast young workforce to meet the requirements of the job market.
title: India’s Main Challenge Is Skills Gap for Young, Sitharaman Says

description: The sister of North Korean leader Kim Jong Un referred to South Korea and Ukraine as “lunatics” after they warned that Pyongyang was sending troops to support Russia in its war against Ukraine.
title: Kim Jong Un’s Sister Calls South Korea and Ukraine ‘Lunatics’

description: Turkey and Niger signed a provisional pact to boost cooperation in mining, a sign of closer ties between the countries as new powers jostle for access to the West African nation’s uranium resources.
title: Turkey Eyes Niger Mining Projects Amid Competition for Uranium

description: A new natural gas pipeline could help reduce poverty in the underdeveloped Yucatan — but it poses a challenge to Sheinbaum’s push to cut emissions
title: The Climate Scientist Who Leads Mexico Is Betting on Decades of Fossil Fuel

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: A Divided BRICS Seeks to Challenge US-led Order

description: Mozambique opposition leader Venâncio Mondlane called on supporters to hold a two-day national shutdown to paralyze activity in the southeast African nation following the Oct. 9 elections that he called fraudulent.
title: Mozambique Opposition Leader Calls for National Shutdown

description: Chancellor Olaf Scholz urged Germany’s employers to hire more people and pay higher wages to help revive economic growth.
title: Scholz Urges More Hiring, Higher Wages to Revive German Growth

description: Singapore ordered the blocking of 10 fake websites linked to foreign actors that could be used to “mount hostile information campaigns” against the city-state.
title: Singapore Bars 10 Foreign-Linked Websites for Potential Threat

description: Taiwan said it will not move its representative office from Pretoria, South Africa’s administrative capital, after accusing Beijing of pressuring South Africa to ask for a relocation.
title: Taiwan Rejects South African Demand to Move Office From Pretoria

description: Refinery work is set to push processing to the lowest since 2022
title: Russia’s Seaborne Crude Shipments Rise to the Highest Since June

description: The MAGA-friendly CEO is now a central target for the opposition to Trump.
title: Elon Musk Is the Democrats’ New Supervillain

description: The only Democratic lawmaker elected statewide in Ohio seeks a fourth term in a race that could determine which party controls the Senate.
title: Sherrod Brown Courts Trump Voters to Hold Ohio Senate Seat Vital for Democrats

description: South Korea has raised the prospect of sending weapons to Ukraine, in response to North Korea’s reported dispatch of troops to Russia to support Moscow’s war on Ukraine, underscoring the risk of a divided Korean peninsula getting dragged into the conflict.
title: Seoul Eyes Arms for Ukraine Over Alleged North Korean Deployment

description: While President Vladimir Putin is eager to demonstrate to fellow leaders at the BRICS summit that Russia is shrugging off Western sanctions over his war in Ukraine, organizers are sending foreign guests a different message — bring cash.
title: Russia Has a Message for BRICS Summit Goers: Bring Cash

description: The estranged brother of former Singapore Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong said he has been given political asylum by the UK government on grounds of a “well-founded fear” of persecution.
title: Singapore Ex-Leader’s Brother Gets Political Asylum in UK

description: China signaled it reached a deal with India on easing border tensions, potentially ending a four-year border stalemate that has frayed relations between the Asian giants.
title: China Says It Reached ‘Resolutions’ With India on Border Dispute

description: The US’s top diplomat landed in Israel on Tuesday, with Joe Biden trying to bring cease-fires in Lebanon and Gaza closer before American elections in a fortnight.
title: US Seeks to Calm Mideast as Israel and Hezbollah Trade More Fire

description: The US is in talks with several Southeast Asian nations about deploying small modular nuclear reactors, as global interest in the low-carbon energy source increases.
title: US in Talks With Asian Nations to Deploy Small Nuclear Reactors

description: Poland’s government could help accelerate interest-rate cuts by bringing forward reductions in budget spending, according to the International Monetary Fund.
title: IMF Says Faster Budget Tightening May Speed Up Polish Rate Cuts

description: UK plans to protect employees against unfair dismissal from their first day in a new job threatens to reduce the number of candidates hired from underrepresented backgrounds, employment experts said, as the government estimated the policy could cost businesses tens of millions of pounds a year.
title: UK’s Worker Rights Revamp Will Hurt Diverse Hiring, Lawyers Warn

description: Philippine President Ferdinand Marcos Jr.’s eldest son on Tuesday came to his father’s defense, saying Vice President Sara Duterte “crossed the line” with her attacks as the feud between the nation’s biggest political clans escalates.
title: Marcos-Duterte Feud Spirals With Philippine Heirs in Fiery Row

description: Central bankers are concerned that Donald Trump will unleash a new trade war if he returns to the White House, making their job much harder.
title: Europe’s Recurring Economic Nightmare — a Trump Election Victory

description: Russia’s role in the European Union’s liquefied natural gas market is growing, even as the bloc weighs how to clamp down on supplies from the nation.
title: Russia’s Share in European LNG Market Grows Despite Concern

description: President Vladimir Putin will play host to Russia’s biggest gathering of world leaders since the invasion of Ukraine and use the BRICS summit to show the US and its allies that he’s no pariah.
title: Russia Hosts BRICS Leaders, Signaling Putin Is Far From Isolated
